instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (emc 2554*)  display issues and possible bad RAM or overheating.
threads.message: Blocks of lines appear over displayed image from time to time (twisting the display slightly sometime makes lines go away, Freezes occasionally, auto reboots occasionally, gets black screen 3-beep RAM error on boot from time to time, but passes Apple hardware diagnostic testing (both quick and extended). No signs of heavy wear, abuse, or liquid damage.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (emc 2554*)  display issues and possible bad RAM or overheating.
threads.message: Bad RAM or slot. Try known good RAM and try 1 slot at a time. RAM slots cannot be repaired, use the remaining good one.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (emc 2554*)  display issues and possible bad RAM or overheating.
threads.message: Thank you very much, I see that your answer is spot on.  I learned something new today, I love it when that happens. :)
